meanings.definition: The path followed by a projectile flying or an object moving under the action of given forces.
meanings.sent1: The trajectory of the ball was straight towards the goalpost.
meanings.sent2: The scientist calculated the trajectory of the rocket before launch.
meanings.sent3: The trajectory of the banana peel slipping on the floor was unexpected.
meanings.sent4: Her trajectory in the dance competition was flawless, like a shooting star.
meanings.sent5: The trajectory of the paper airplane soared high above the classroom.

meanings.definition: The curve described by a projectile, rocket, or the like in its flight.
meanings.sent1: The trajectory of the basketball arced beautifully through the air.
meanings.sent2: The astronauts monitored the trajectory of the spacecraft during reentry.
meanings.sent3: The trajectory of the frisbee had a mind of its own, curving unexpectedly.
meanings.sent4: The trajectory of the rollercoaster looped and twisted like a serpent in the sky.
meanings.sent5: The trajectory of the boomerang always returned to its thrower.
